newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bank of France drains 2.9 bln Ffr at tender.
newsitem.headline: Bank of France drains 2.9 bln Ffr at tender.

text.p: The Bank of France drained 2.9 billion francs at a securities repurchase tender held on Thursday to allocate funds for injection into the money market on Friday.
It accepted bids for 48.4 billion francs in new liquidity, 2.9 billion more than the 45.5 billion leaving the market on Friday when a previous pact expires. The new pact expires on January 24.
The Bank of France said it allocated 14.3 billion francs to bidders offering Treasury bills as collateral, satisfying 4.2 percent of such demand.
It allotted a further 34.1 billion to bidders putting up private paper, satisfying 14.6 percent of this demand.
